etymologies: early 16th century: perhaps of imitative origin and suggested by pigeon

definitions: a dabbling duck with mainly reddish-brown and gray plumage, the male having a whistling call.

notes.text: Genus Anas, family Anatidae: several species, in particular the American wigeon (A. americana)and the Eurasian wigeon (A. penelope)

shortDefinitions: dabbling duck with mainly reddish-brown and grey plumage
